column4: i just installed kubuntu 8.10 on a brand new comp(no dual boot) how can i have full media support(music and video)?
sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-extras
that should get you everything in terms of multimedia, and yea switch to ubuntu, kde 4 is just not usable
yet
sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
no, it will add gnome to kde, you'll have to hunt down the packages manually to completely remove kde hang on
http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/puregnome
hey
run it
sudo dpkg --configure 0a
replace it you mean with gdm?
it says that kdm is tipically stopped when removing  or updatin pkgs, if I stop it now, all sessions will be terminated, otherwise the 'new version' will take effect on next reboot. Yes No.
select no, it just means you'll have to reboot, if you stop you'll lose your gui
yep it should
all done.
check your pms when you have the time to
i don't know which one you downloaded? either way install flashplugin-nonfree should take care of it
just run uname -a to find out what version of ubuntu you're running, 32 or 64 bit
